gurmukhi: ieq so niRp jUiJ krY hir isau auq qy muslI iek bYn sunwXo ] mwr ibdwr dey qumry Bt qY mn mY nhI nYk ljwXo ]
transliteration: It So Nrip Joojh(i) Darai Har(i) Sio Out Te Mousliik Bain Sounaayo|| Maar Bidaar Dae Toumre Bhat Tai Ma Mai Nahinaik Lajaayo||
translation: On this side the king is fighting with Krishna and on that side Balram said to the king, “We have killed your warriors, but still you do not feel ashamed;

gurmukhi: ry niRp kwhy kau jUJ mrY iPr jwhu GrY lr kw Gl pwXo ] qw qy bfo jF hY miRg BUpiq kyhir so rn jIqn AwXo ]1846]
transliteration: Re Nrip Kaahe Kau Joojh Darai Phir Jaahu Ghrai Lar Kaa Ghal Paayo|| Taa Te Bado Jadh Hai Mrig Bhoopat(i) Kehar(i) So Ran Jeetan Aayo||1846||
translation: “O king ! go back to your home; what will you gain by fighting? O king! you are like deer and are only dreaming about your victory over the lion.1846.

gurmukhi: ijh suBtin bil lrq hY qy sB gey prwie ] kY lir mir kY Bwij siT kY pr hir ky pwie ]1847]
transliteration: Jih Soubhatan(i) Bal(i) Larat Hai Te Sabh Gad Paraae|| Kai Lar(i) Mar(i) Kai Bhaaj(i) Sath Kai Par Har(i) Ke Paae||1847||
translation: “The warriors on whose strength you are fighting, they have all fled away; therefore O fool ! either run away while fighting or fall down at the feet of Krishna.”1847.
Speech of Jarasandh addressed to Balram:

gurmukhi: khw BXo mm Er ky sUr hny sMgRwm ] lrbo mrbo jIqbo ieh suBtin ky kwm ]1848]
transliteration: Kahaa Bhayo Mam Or Ke Soor Hane Sanraam|| Larbo Marbo Jeetho Eh Soubhatan(i) Ke Kaam||1848||
translation: “What if the warriors of my side have been killed, the tasks of the warriors are fighting, dying or gaining victory.”1848.

gurmukhi: XoN kih kY mn kop BrXo qb BUp hlI khu bwn clwXo ] lwgiq hI nt swl BXo qn mY blBdR mhwN duKu pwXo ]
transliteration: Yon Kah(i) Kai Man Kop Bdaryo Tab Bhoop Halikauh Baan Chalaayo|| Laagad(i) Hinat Saal Bhayo Tan Mai Balbhadra Mahaan Doukh(u) Paayo||
translation: Saying this, in great fury, the king shot an arrow towards Balram; which when hit him, gave him extreme agony;

gurmukhi: mUrC hÍY kir sXMdn bIc igrXo iqh ko kib ny jsu gwXo ] mwnhu bwn BujMg fsXo Dnu Dwm sBY mn qy ibsrwXo ]1849]
transliteration: Moondachh Hvai Kar(i) Syandan Beech Giryo Tih Ko Kabi Ne Jas(u) Gadyo|| Maanoh Baan Bhujan Dasyo Dhan(u) Dhaam Sabhai Man Te Bisraayo||1849||
translation: He became unconscious and fell in his chariot as if the snake-like arrow had stung him and he had fallen down forgetting his wealth and home.1849.

gurmukhi: bhuro icq cyq BXo bldyv icqY Air ko Aiq kop bFwXo ] BwrI gdw gih kY kir mY niRp ky bD kwrn qw rn AwXo ]
transliteration: Bahuro Chit Chet Bhayo Baldev Chitai Ar(i) Ko At(i) Kop Badhaayo|| Bhaarigadaa Gih Kai Kar(i) Mai Nrip Ke Badh Kaaran Taa Ran Aayo||
translation: When Balram regained consciousness, he became extremely enraged; he caught hold of his huge mace and got ready again in the battlefield in order to kill the enemy;

gurmukhi: pwau ipAwdy huie sXMdn qy kib sXwm khY ieh BwNq isDwXo ] Aaur iksI Bt jwnXo nhI kib daur prXo niRp ny liK pwXo ]1850]
transliteration: Paao Piaade Hue Syandan Te Kabi Syaam Kahai Eh Bhaant Sidhaayo|| Aur Kisibhat Jaanyo Nahikabi Daur Daryo Nrip Ne Lakh(i) Paayo||1850||
translation: Leaving his chariot, he ran away even on foot and none could see him except the king.1850.

gurmukhi: Awvq dyK hlw XuD ko su BXo qbhI niRp kop meI hY ] ju`Du hI kau smuhwie BXo inj pwn kmwn su qwn leI hY ]
transliteration: Oovat Dekh Halaa Yudh Ko Soun Bhayo Tab-hinrip Kop Maihai|| Juddh(u) Hikau Samuhaae Bhayo Nij Paan Kamaan Su Taan Laihai||
translation: Seeing Balram coming, the king got enraged and pulling his bow with his hand, he got ready for war;
